Exploration Mode

Systems and mechanics for investigating, searching, and discovering

When characters are delving into dungeons, searching for clues, or investigating their surroundings, you're in Exploration Mode. Time is more flexible than combat but more structured than downtime.

Core Systems for Exploration

Exploration Activities

The primary system for this mode:

  • Drawing Maps: Tracking your route through complex areas
  • Foraging: Finding food and water (Survival DC 15/20)
  • Navigating: Finding your way (Survival DC varies)
  • Tracking: Following creatures' trails (Survival DC 10-20)
  • Keeping Watch: Staying alert for danger (Perception)
  • Sneaking: Moving stealthily as a group (Stealth)

Skills & Ability Checks

Heavily used during exploration:

  • Perception: Noticing details, spotting hidden things
  • Investigation: Searching areas, finding clues
  • Survival: Tracking, foraging, navigating wilderness
  • Stealth: Sneaking past enemies or avoiding detection

Senses & Vision

Perception and detection:

  • Darkvision: See in darkness (60 ft. typically)
  • Blindsight: Perceive without sight
  • Tremorsense: Detect vibrations through ground
  • Truesight: See through illusions and invisibility

Environmental Effects & Hazards

Dangers of exploration:

  • Falling: 1d6 per 10 feet fallen
  • Suffocation: Minutes equal to 1 + CON mod (minimum 30 seconds)
  • Wilderness Hazards: Quicksand, razorvine, slippery ice
  • Temperature Extremes: Extreme cold/heat requires saves

Common Exploration Scenarios

  • Dungeon Delving: Searching rooms, avoiding traps, finding secret doors
  • Wilderness Tracking: Following monsters or quarry through forests
  • Urban Investigation: Gathering clues in a city
  • Stealth Missions: Infiltrating enemy strongholds

Transitioning Out of Exploration Mode

Exploration mode typically transitions to:

  • Combat Mode: When encountering hostile creatures
  • Interaction Mode: When meeting NPCs or discovering important story elements
  • Travel Mode: When leaving detailed exploration for overland journeys
  • Downtime Mode: When resting or spending extended time in one place
